intro: Ardisia rufa, commonly known as the red-berried evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its berries, which turn red when mature, are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia rufa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal flowering.
